Class PetStorage

java.lang.Object
PetStorage
public class PetStorage extends Object
The PetStorage class is responsible for handling the storage and retrieval of pet data in the pet adoption system. It provides methods to save, load, add, and remove pets using file-based storage.

This class uses serialization to persist pet data to a file and retrieve it when needed.

Key functionalities include:

  • Saving the list of pets to a file
  • Loading the list of pets from a file
  • Adding a new pet to the storage
  • Removing a pet from the storage
  • Loading only pets that are available for adoption

      public PetStorage()

  • Method Details

    • saveAnimals

      public static void saveAnimals(List<Pet> animals)
      Saves the list of pets to the storage file.
      Parameters:
      animals - the List<Pet> to be saved

    • loadAnimals

      public static List<Pet> loadAnimals()
      Loads the list of pets from the storage file. If the file does not exist or cannot be read, an empty list is returned.
      Returns:
      a List<Pet> containing all pets loaded from the file

    • loadAnimalsFromFile

      public static List<Pet> loadAnimalsFromFile()
      Loads only the pets that are available for adoption from the storage file.
      Returns:
      a List<Pet> containing pets that are not yet adopted

    • addAnimal

      public static void addAnimal(Pet newPet)
      Adds a new pet to the storage. The pet is added to the existing list of pets, and the updated list is saved to the file.
      Parameters:
      newPet - the Pet object to be added

    • removeAnimal

      public static void removeAnimal(Pet aniID)
      Removes a pet from the storage by its ID. The pet is removed from the existing list of pets, and the updated list is saved to the file.
      Parameters:
      aniID - the Pet object to be removed
